org.apache.felix.ipojo.dependency.interceptors

Class DefaultServiceTrackingInterceptor

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.felix.ipojo.dependency.interceptors.DefaultDependencyInterceptor
      • org.apache.felix.ipojo.dependency.interceptors.DefaultServiceTrackingInterceptor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DependencyInterceptor, ServiceTrackingInterceptor

    public class DefaultServiceTrackingInterceptor
extends DefaultDependencyInterceptor
implements ServiceTrackingInterceptor
    Default implementation of the default service tracking interceptor. It accepts all references and keeps the dependencies in the `dependencies` list. This list is guarded by the monitor lock. It also provides an `invalidateMatchingServices` method notifying all managed dependencies of a change in the matching service set.

    • Method Detail

      • accept

        public <S> TransformedServiceReference<S> accept(DependencyModel dependency,
                                        BundleContext context,
                                        TransformedServiceReference<S> ref)
        Default implementation of the accept method. The default behavior is to accept all services as they are (no transformation).
        Specified by:
        accept in interface ServiceTrackingInterceptor
        Type Parameters:
        S - the type of service
        Parameters:
        dependency - the dependency the dependency
        context - the context of the dependency the bundle context used by the dependency
        ref - the reference the reference to accept, transform or reject
        Returns:
        the reference as it is.

      • invalidateMatchingServices

        public void invalidateMatchingServices()
        Notifies the managed dependencies of a change in the set of services accepted by this interceptor. The dependency will call the accept method to recompute the set of matching services.
